reg:regulation.reg:acttitle:
Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act,
Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act and
Motion Picture Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Fee Setting Criteria Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 104/2017, April 1, 2017]

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fees or charges payable in respect of licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 179 of the Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act, section 59 of the Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act and section 12.6 of the Motion Picture Act, the administrative authority must comply with a fee setting process that is in accordance with the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: before setting fees, charges or other amounts under those sections, the authority must consult with

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the industry the authority considers affected, and
any parties the authority considers interested;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the authority must give at least 90 days' notice to the affected industry before a fee, charge or other amount set by the authority has effect.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Business Practices and Consumer Protection Act, S.B.C. 2004, c. 2, section 179; Cremation, Interment and Funeral Services Act, S.B.C. 2004, c. 35, section 59; Motion Picture Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 314, section 14.1]
